RSS 2.0	Atom 1.0
author	author*
category	category
channel	feed
copyright	rights
—	subtitle
description*	summary and/or content
generator	generator
guid	id*
image	logo
item	entry
lastBuildDate (in channel)	updated*
link*	link*
managingEditor	author or contributor
pubDate	published (subelement of entry)
title*	title*
ttl	—

story.text: Both RSS and [[Atom (Web standard)]] are widely supported and are compatible with all major consumer feed readers. RSS gained wider use because of early feed reader support - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS#RSS_compared_with_Atom wikipedia]
Technically, Atom has several advantages: less restrictive licensing, [[Internet Assigned Numbers Authority]]-registered [[MIME type]], [[XML namespace]], [[URI]] support, [[RELAX NG]] support.
The following table shows RSS elements alongside [[Atom (standard)]] elements where they are equivalent.

> |RSS 2.0        |  Atom 1.0
|---------------|----------:
|author         |author*   
|category       |category
|channel        |feed
|copyright      |rights
|—	        |subtitle
|description*   |summary and/or content
|generator      |generator
|guid           |id*
|image          |logo
|item           |entry
|lastBuildDate  |updated*
|link*          |link*
|managingEditor |author or contributor
|pubDate        |published (subelement of entry)
|title*         |title*
|ttl            |—
Note: the [[asterisk]] character (*) indicates that an element must be provided (Atom elements "author" and "link" are only required under certain conditions).
